info.name: Github API
info.description:
The requests in this collection use the [GitHub API](https://docs.github.com/en/rest) to fetch repo and user data, and create a new repo and upload a `README.md` file.

### Authorization

We are using Basic Auth (username and password) to authorize the API. This is fine in non-production scenarios, but if you are making a production app read the [recommendations in the GitHub API documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/overview/other-authentication-methods).

Your personal access token can be obtained from your GitHub `Settings > Developer settings > Personal access tokens`. Treat this token like a password and keep it secret.

Save your `personalAccessToken` as a variable of the same name on this collection. Click on the collection `Github API` then the `Variables` tab to access the collection variables.

ONLY PUT IN THE "CURRENT VALUE" COLUMN OF THE `personalAccessToken` collection variable - this will prevent the value from being visible our shared to others who view your collection.

### Converting to code

Click the icon on the far right of any request to see code snippet examples for how to make the request in various coding languages.

exec: // btoa is a library for encoding strings into base64 format
// get the raw README text content from the collection variables
// base64 encode the data for transport (GitHub API expects this)
// set as a collection variable named "content64" so we can use {{content64}} in the body of this request
// discard the base64 encoded content from collection variables

variable.value:

This readme brought to you by APIs and Postman
